newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: ABB heads China power project.
newsitem.headline: ABB heads China power project.

text.p: Electrical engineering group ABB Asea Brown Boveri AG said it was leading a consortium that won a $650 million order for a 700 megawatt coal-fired power plant in China.
ABB said its share of the order was $300 million.
ABB said in a statement it was leading a group of Chinese companies in building Hefei No 2 power plant 400 km west of Shanghai near Hefei, the capital of Anhiou Province.
ABB's responsibility is to supply two 350-megawatt steam turbines, the electrical generators and electro-mechanical equipment as well as the overall power plant control system," the company said.
"ABB will also be responsible for the engineering and turnkey project management," the statement added.
In Mannheim, ABB Kraftwerke said it would serve as project manager responsible for engineering and delivery of steam turbines to its Chinese partners.
The rest of the consortium were Chinese companies, including a local civil construction company and the Harbin Power Engineering Company.
The order was placed by local power group Anhui Hefei United Power Generation Ltd and the plant will use coal from a neighbouring mine, ABB said.
